device.label: KNX Device
device.object-description: A device is usually a physical thing that offers one or more services. Devices can be asasigned to homes and rooms in your HomeKit app

fields.label: Device name
fields.infotext: The device name allows you to find the device in your homekit app.

fields.label: UUID
fields.infotext: Defining a UUID allows you to keep homekit data (such as Scene allocation) even if you change the device name.

service.label: Service
service.object-description: A service is offered by a (physical) device, such as a switch service. A service has one or more characteristics (properties), which represent either status or command functions, such as On/Off

fields.label: Service name
fields.infotext: The service name is required to address the service through Siri. If you have multiple services in one device, the service names have to be unique - which is a good idea anyhow.

fields.label: Description
fields.infotext: You can stow your description/remarks here

fields.label: Service type
fields.infotext: Homekit supports multiple service types, you must choose one here.
Homekit supports multiple characteristics, please choose

fields.label: address
fields.infotext: The group address used for bus communication, format 31/7/255

fields.label: Name
fields.infotext: You can give it a name for later reference and easier maintenance

fields.label: Data Point Type (DPT)
fields.infotext: data point type describes the telegram type and the contents of the data sent to the bus

fields.label: Readable
fields.infotext: Is Homebridge allowed to send READ REQUESTS to the bus? Some devices interpret answers as switching commands, so if your devices suddenly change state this could be a reason. Passive listening is always allowed.

fields.label: Read on server start
fields.infotext: Should Homebridge issue a READ REQUEST to the bus upon server start? Readable flag is also required.

fields.label: Writable
fields.infotext: If set to no, Homekit cannot write to this address

fields.label: Comment
fields.infotext: Anything you want to store here.
